name: Onboarding clusters to IAM-Troubleshooter.txt - About IAM-Troubleshooter
description: This section introduces IAM-Troubleshooter, a tool designed to help diagnose and resolve issues related to pod access to AWS IAM (Identity and Access Management). It provides a brief overview of the tool's purpose and includes a link to a resource where more information can be found. The section aims to give a high-level understanding of IAM-Troubleshooter's functionality for those who may not be familiar with it.
use_cases: Troubleshooting pod access issues to AWS IAM
Diagnosing and resolving problems related to pod authentication and authorization with AWS IAM
Identifying and addressing misconfigurations or permission-related issues that prevent pods from accessing AWS resources

name: Onboarding clusters to IAM-Troubleshooter.txt - How to Onboard a new cluster to IAM-Troubleshooter?
description: This section outlines the steps to onboard a new Kubernetes cluster to the IAM-Troubleshooter tool. It involves deploying the IAM-Troubleshooter application on the cluster using a Helm chart, exposing it via an ingress route, verifying its successful deployment by accessing the endpoint, and sharing the endpoint with the DevOps team for integration with the Jarvis frontend.
use_cases: Onboarding a new Kubernetes cluster to the IAM-Troubleshooter tool
Deploying and exposing the IAM-Troubleshooter application on a cluster
Integrating IAM-Troubleshooter with the Jarvis frontend
capabilities: Sharing endpoint for integration with Jarvis frontend
